intro: Wedelia argentea, commonly known as silverleaf wedelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features silver-gray foliage due to dense covering of fine hairs, which gives it a distinctive appearance. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and bloom during the warmer months. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
